episodes.title: 8 | This Is Not A Banksy - Part One
episodes.summary:
Unsuspecting Sam Bobienski gets plucked out of his content and happy life as a fast food chicken server and thrust into the bizarre hipster art world when a mysterious artist draws a picture on his butt at a party. Could it be a Banksy? His girlfriend thinks it is and is convinced that this is their ticket to fame and fortune. Sam is not so sure.  Don't miss our host David Rheinstrom's interview with X Files Executive Producer, Glen Morgan after the show. 

Guest stars Mario Lopez and Heather McDonald.

New to Secrets, Crimes & Audiotape? Don't miss the next episode: subscribe today at smarturl.it/sca

episodes.title: 7 | Becky Shaw - Part Four
episodes.summary:
Becky is still reeling from her disastrous date with Max. Max continues to feel nothing but contempt for what he perceives as her inability to get over a mere blip on the radar of life. Susanna is more fearful than ever of Andrew's efforts to comfort Becky in her hour of need. And now Susanna's mother is back with a catastrophe of her own. This is the final episode of Becky Shaw.

episodes.title: 7 | Becky Shaw - Part Three
episodes.summary:
Things didn’t go so well on Max and Becky’s date. We learn that they were held up at gunpoint and Becky is understandably upset, mostly because Max has not bothered to call her since that night. Susanna is outraged at Max’s insensitivity. She is also concerned that Andrew has swept in to comfort Becky and, as Susanna was once the beneficiary of Andrew's heroism, she knows where that might lead.

episodes.title: 7 | Becky Shaw - Part Two
episodes.summary:

Susanna and Andrew are setting the ever affable Max up on a date with Becky Shaw. What could go possibly go wrong?

episodes.title: 5 | Wait Wait Don't Kill Me - Part Five
episodes.summary:
In the epic finale, Sarah’s journey charges towards its violent, thrilling and rhythmic conclusion. As Charlie races to Baltimore to stop Asia from testifying, Sarah has an earth-shattering revelation that breaks the case wide open. But will it be enough to pacify Ira? Will Adnan get to her first? Who will live? Who will die? Will Sarah finally earn her Peabody? Take your friendly earbuds and place them in your ears. All your questions will be answered as the world’s first serialized podcast musical concludes in spectacular fashion. | Part Five of Five |

episodes.title: 5 | Wait Wait Don't Kill Me - Part Four
episodes.summary:
With the judge in Adnan’s case on the verge of granting him a retrial, Adnan confronts Sarah about the secret she hoped he’d never learn. Flashing back to 1998 we learn more about the role Jay really played in Hae’s death, while back in the present Ira threatens Sarah with the truth. As Sarah’s world begins to collapse around her, her ex-boyfriend and current CEO of Online Correspondence Chimp takes drastic action to make sure Adnan never gets out of prison. But it might be too little too late. | Part Four of Five |

episodes.title: 5 | Wait Wait Don't Kill Me - Part Two
episodes.summary:
Sarah’s secrets are catching up with her. She gains access to the physical evidence from the original Adnan Syed case courtesy of an overeager intern. Unfortunately, they don’t have the money to properly analyze it for DNA. A reluctant Sarah speaks with Adnan for the first time and he’s excited to finally meet someone who can clear his name. Meanwhile, Ira wants to spin Sarah’s story off into its own podcast and finds sponsorship money from an unlikely chonnection — Sarah’s ex, founder of internet startup Online Correspondence Chimp.  |Part Two of Five|

episodes.title: 5 | Wait Wait Don't Kill Me - Part One
episodes.summary:
Welcome to Wait Wait Don't Kill Me, the first ever podcast musical. Like Serial Season One, only with much more singing. In the opening episode, a young Sarah Koenig, a beat reporter for the Baltimore Sun, needs a big story to boost her career. Voices in her head give her an idea that could make her dream of working for Ira Glass come true. Years later we find Sarah working at This American Life, where Ira wants to do a show about murder. He asks a nervous Sarah to recount the murder that made her career and possibly solve it, something she immediately regrets. |Part One of Five|

episodes.title: 4 | Severed Threads - Part Three

episodes.title: BONUS | The Bright Sessions
episodes.summary:
The Bright Sessions is a science fiction podcast that follows a group of therapy patients. But these are not your typical patients - each has a unique supernatural ability. The show documents their struggles and discoveries as well as the motivations of their mysterious therapist, Dr. Bright.

You can listen to more on iTunes, Stitcher, or wherever you listen to podcasts, and find out more at www.thebrightsessions.com.

episodes.title: 3 | Love Contract
episodes.summary:
Laura's secret was that she was dating Derek - but she couldn't keep it from her nameless, manipulative Manager (Jane Kaczmareck). Inspired by real-life company rules that require employees to disclose a romantic  relationship and acknowledge they could be fired over it, this dark, twisted comedy takes that premise to the point of absurdity, then shock. Laura is played by Jocelyn Towne. Written by Mike Bartlett.

(A warning: this probably not an episode you want to listen around kids, or if you're expecting one)

episodes.title: 1 | Air Force One - Part Two
episodes.summary:
Jacqueline Kennedy had a secret: she never trusted LBJ, according to this fictionalized account of the 60 minutes that followed the assassination of JFK. This play by Christopher Lee, and the theories it explores are based on Federal, classified and academic research; diaries and recollections of those who were in Dallas that afternoon and aboard the presidential jet, including Kennedy’s widow. It is an area of contested as well as substantiated documentation. Some names have been changed and some of the conversations imagined…

episodes.title: 1 | Air Force One - Part One
episodes.summary:
In the immediate aftermath of the assassination of JFK, President-to-be Lyndon Johnson (Stacy Keach) seems very interested in appearing close to Jacqueline Kennedy (Glenne Headly). So interested that it makes you wonder… what’s his secret? This play by Christopher Lee, and the theories it explores are based on Federal, classified and academic research; diaries and recollections of those who were in Dallas that afternoon and aboard the presidential jet, including Kennedy’s widow. It is an area of contested as well as substantiated documentation. Some names have been changed and some of the conversations imagined…
